[

Automation Developer | Senior Consultant

Company Name Reveal Group Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 27 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Looking for an exciting opportunity to work within the Intelligent Automation space? Keen to shape the digital transformations of top-tiers organisations around the world?\xa0Ready to build a career in consulting with the 1st pure-play partner to be recognised as a Gold Blue Prism Capability Provider, globally?

\xa0

As an Automation Developer, you will work with our clients to scope, design, develop and deploy automation solutions alongside our industry-leading team. You will be\xa0an experienced software developer with a natural ability to influence and collaborate with stakeholders to support and drive operational efficiencies using the latest technologies. Whether you're an Accredited RPA developer, or a future-minded Consultant looking for the best on-the-job training, we would love to speak with you.

\xa0

Reveal Group are Blue Prism specialists, having worked together since 2014. We have the largest number of accredited Professional Developers in Australia and have implemented Blue Prism for clients in more than 20 industries across USA, UK, Australia, Canada, South Africa and Asia. Our unique approach leverages our experience, IP and training to quickly build client capability and self-sufficiency. Organisations look to us to start and scale their Blue Prism programs. We are one of only 5 Gold partners, globally.


You are passionate about:

  • Improving business performance through the application of cutting-edge technologies
  • Building effective relationships with key stakeholders through strong communication skills
  • Time management and attention to detail
  • Thinking on your feet and embracing new challenges as they arrive
  • Contributing to the successful delivery of projects
  • Constantly seeking new challenges and opportunities
  • Being part of and contributing to the growth and success of a leading global business improvement consultancy

Your key responsibilities:
  • Analysing and documenting client processes
  • Implementing robotic process automation solutions (Reveal Group provide extensive RPA training and accreditation)
  • Facilitating training workshops on operations management and process automation
  • Working side-by-side with clients to implement operations improvement programs
  • Identifying, tracking and monitoring project deliverables to ensure successful project completion
  • Providing on-going support and expertise to clients

\xa0

Your skills & experience:
  • Undergraduate degree in business, IT, engineering, mathematics, science or other relevant discipline is required
  • Experience in software development and preferably knowledge of the .NET Framework
  • Experience and/or certification with Blue Prism, UiPath, Automation Anywhere are a plus
  • Being a highly talented problem-solver
  • Strong communication skills – both oral and written (fluency in English is mandatory and a second language is beneficial)
  • Capacity to think on your feet and embrace new challenges as they arise

\xa0

Other requirements:

  • Residency and work visas in Australia/New Zealand
  • Preparedness to travel both within Australia and internationally
  • Eligibility to pass background checks that may be required for key clients

\xa0

What's in it for you?
Located in fantastic Melbourne offices in the city’s burgeoning tech-hub, Cremorne, \xa0you'll work in an incredibly fun and rewarding business that prides itself on its unique culture and family mentality. We genuinely love working together. You’ll receive an attractive salary and opportunities to constantly learn and upskill, with opportunities to travel interstate and internationally, including to our offices in the\xa0USA and South Africa.\xa0

\xa0

If you like the sound of this role, we'd love to hear from you!
To apply, please attach your resume and a cover letter outlining what you’ll bring to the position.

835970858:
[

Change Coordinator - Infrastructure

Company Name Green Light Worldwide Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 52 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Green Light Worldwide’ s delivery team is looking for a Change Coordinator in either Sydney or Melbourne to join a large program of work and play a key role in the successful a Data Centre Migration.

\xa0

The Change Coordinator is responsible for the day-to-day management of the change request process. This is accomplished through building and reviewing change plans based on requirements provided by the Project Manager and Technical Services Lead, ensuring that the change proceeds in a timely fashion and ensuring that lead times are met. The Change Coordinator will keep the individual Project Managers and PMO informed of task accomplishment, issues and status updates.

\xa0\xa0

Responsibilities:

  • Day to day management of the change request process.
  • Provide input into planning change management activities.
  • Build and review the project change plans.
  • Coordinate with project managers, account team and other stakeholders to obtain required information to facilitate change requests.
  • Build and manage a forward schedule of change.
  • Support the service management lead in engagement and training of project team members in service management processes.
  • Provide support where required to project managers to qualify readiness for transition and operation of the solution post implementation for large complex changes or multiple changes.
  • Attend account and other change boards as required, and support and represent all programme change submissions.
  • Engage as the service provider change manager in a multi-vendor environment.
  • Apply continual improvement and communicate lessons learned to further improvements in policies, processes, and procedures.
  • Adherence to standardized documentation, communication, reporting, monitoring, and audit requirements.
  • Conducting post-implementation reviews to validate the results of the change request.

\xa0

Requirements:

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience using an enterprise service management platform such as ServiceNow or HP Service Manager
  • Experience in technical change, attendance at Change Boards and creation of submissions to change boards.
  • Experience with infrastructure and/or application relocation projects.
  • Broad understanding of the technologies involved and an ability to perceive gaps in explanations and descriptions.
  • Experience with distributed and leveraged delivery models.
  • Ability to work with conflicting goals and agendas of different teams.
  • Enthusiasm for asking probing questions.
  • Ability to manage and drive the change management process.
  • Strong analytical skills.
  • Understand, utilise and share knowledge of ITIL.
  • Experience in multi-vendor environments.


Desirable Requirements:

  • Some experience with enterprise application architectures.
  • Experience in the Government, Financial and/or Telecommunications industries.
  • Experience in the one or more of the areas of infrastructure, middleware, networking, security, data management, or application development.
  • Experience with Data Centres and/or Data Centre Migrations.


Special Requirements:

  • Australian citizenship and an existing Federal Government Security clearance, or ability to obtain one.
  • Some out of hours work and travel may be required.

835966014:
[

Senior Consultant

Company Name State of Matter Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 105 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

State of Matter was established because we recognised the need for an alternative to the big consulting firms, a new approach that single-mindedly focuses on and drives the customer’s agenda. By integrating management consulting, project delivery and technology solutions we enable transition\xa0and drive business performance.


Here at State of Matter we’re experiencing significant growth which means we need\xa0 further Digital Strategy and Transformation Senior Consultants to work with us and our clients on a range of exciting assignments including: digital, CX/UX experieince, strategy development, benefits realisation, technology enabled transformation, operating model, business process management & improvement, project management, analytics and optimisation; across various sectors.


As a Digital Strategy and Transformation Senior Consultant you will be expected to learn, understand and apply State of Matter’s methodologies. This entails work stream planning or structuring of approach/analysis, overseeing analysis and insights, coordinating work of Analyst or Consultant and managing and developing peer level client relationships.


You’ll also be doing:

  • Developing and managing project plans and structured business analysis including business requirements, functional and non-functional specifications, process analysis
  • Build and manage relationships and interact with senior client stakeholders
  • Work with our Practice Director, Consulting Directors or BD Directors on proposals \xa0
  • Be accountable and responsible for the development and fulfilment of assignments
  • Establishing technology as a key enabler of business strategy through the development of pragmatic IT strategic and transformation plans
  • Shaping, building, and helping deploy tailored technology solutions to enable our client's success
  • Helping organisations achieve best in class performance through alternative sourcing models, realigned operating models or project delivery improvement
  • Delivering specific solutions which address business issues such as CX, UX, Digital transformation, the convergence of IT and OT (operational technology).


We’re looking for:

  • At least 3 years Consulting experience that has given you a solid grounding across strategy, analysis, and project delivery.
  • Strong communication and structured writing and thinking skills.
  • People who like to surround themselves with high performers and are known out performer amongst your peers.
  • Knowledge of the use and impact of IT on clients’ business and industry in order to identify potential issues or business opportunities
  • An ability to analyse and make recommendations on the use of technology enablers and industry points of view
  • People who can lead and conduct a system specification and selection process whilst defining system and business requirements at a functional level
  • A knowledge of architecture services, hardware, standards and frameworks and an ability to consult to clients around the importance of architecture from a business perspective
  • An inquisitive mind and a passion for improving client’s business performance.


Our aim is for you to work in a great trust based culture, and to accelerate your career, by having you work on interesting and challenging projects with the backing of a supportive management team. We're a flexible and diverse workplace that offer great salary and benefits and are committed to continuous learning.

SEO Specialist

Company Name Adaptify Digital Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 68 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Adaptify is looking for an extremely switched on, productive & experienced SEO Developer/Technician - Melbourne Applicants Only


Any candidate who can demonstrate the following will definitely be a good fit!


  • A track record of Creating & Implementing SEO Strategies that has delivered results for Australian SME Websites
  • Experience delegating tasks within a team environment
  • Can estimate resources & timeframes for SEO tasks like sitemap creation & 301 Redirects
  • Is confident in using & developing standard operating processes
  • Extremely proficient across a wide array of CMS’s and coding languages


If this is you, read on!


Adaptify is a Melbourne based international Inbound Marketing Agency that is growing FAST.


You will enjoy a high level of autonomy, freedom & responsibility in this role - working within a close knit team of 5 (lead by an account manager) who are dedicated to our client portfolios.

\xa0

We pride ourselves on our work culture as a point of difference from other agencies, which includes...


  • A true family environment - working with switched on, friendly & supportive colleagues

  • High degree of Autonomy - work the way that suits you best with no micro management

  • Empowerment - Got a great idea? We'll listen! If it stands on it's own merits, then it'll be approved, planned & implemented


What you'll be stepping into...


The ideal new member to the Adaptify family will receive work across a mix of existing & new clients - all in various industries, with different budgets and goals.


You'll be instrumental in taking ownership of:


  • SEO Audits (on page, off page, link health, content amongst others)
  • Creation of Keyword Research & Mapping
  • Broken Link Redirects
  • Set up of Search Console, Analytics & UTM tagging.
  • On Page & Off Page SEO Tasks
  • Delegation of secondary work to technical assistants
  • Utilisation of SEO, Analytics & Reporting Tools
  • Data Analysis & Improvement Recommendations


To do the above you’ll need…


  • 3 to 4 years’ experience in implementing SEO tech work within an agency environment
  • Can communicate effectively within a fast paced, team environment
  • Able to project manage tasks within a CRM
  • Must be independent & responsible (required with the freedom & autonomy our work place provides)
  • High attention to detail
  • Thirst for knowledge & self-education


Does this sound like a good fit? Don't be shy, we don't bite \U0001f60a We'd love to have a chat & a potential interview with you!

\xa0

Please feel free to apply via this listing or send your resume to tracy@adaptify.com.au with the keyword "oyster" in the email title so we know you've got the attention to detail!

835977756:
[

CX Designer Manager

Company Name CPA Australia Company Location Melbourne

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 24 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Us

CPA Australia is one of the world’s leading member service organisations, with over 163,000 members across 125 countries. Our core services to members include education, training, technical support and advocacy.

Employees and members work together with local and international bodies to represent the views and concerns of the profession to governments, regulators, industries, academia and the general public.

The Role

Reporting to the Senior Manager Digital Marketing, the CX Design Manager will be responsible for driving the investigation and analysis of different forms of prospective and current member feedback as a way of protecting, promoting and enhancing CPA Australia’s brand credentials.

The CX Design Manager will understand CPA Australia’s business requirements and any technical limitations involved in research, mapping out how we capture data and insights and translating them into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mock-ups and prototypes.

Key responsibilities include:

Supporting the creation, design, maintenance, usability, development and publishing of the CPA Australia corporate website and all other digital assets. Specifically by providing:

  • Support in the creation, design, maintenance, usability, development and publishing of the CPA Australia corporate website and all other digital assets.
  • Expertise in digital user experience and accessibility
  • Expertise in user-centered design and mobile responsive design
  • Front-end web development services (HTML/CSS)
  • Content Management System expertise
  • Focus on aspects of website user experience design that contribute to ‘conversions’, that is, to the number or percentage of site visitors that ultimately contribute directly to CPA Australia’s business goals
  • Collate and integrate user needs to help conceive, define, and evolve solutions for our prospective and current members across a range of mediums and experiences
  • Able to work on challenging projects across all steps of the design process: research, prototyping, and visual design
  • Contribute to a positive culture within the Professional Development team, working collaboratively, with integrity and with a focus on achieving best outcomes

What we are looking for

As the successful candidate, you will bring the following attributes/experience to the role:

  • Ability to work on challenging projects across all steps of the design process: research, prototyping, and visual design
  • CX design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments
  • Expertise in CX software. E.g. Sketch, Balsamiq, Adobe Creative Suite
  • Experience working with Agile software development teams
  • Experience testing designs with Users
  • Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills (preferred)
  • Marketing and/or sales background
  • Experience as a visual designer (desirable)
  • Ability to work with stakeholders to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet their needs and vision
  • Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design
  • A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design
  • A solid grasp of user-centered design and testing methodologies, subsystems, and usability and accessibility concerns
  • Ability to iterate your designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently

If you are successful in this role you will have opportunities for growth and career development through regular coaching and training to ensure your skills are second to none. You will have access to CPA Australia's employee benefits, which provide special offers for products and services such as health insurance, home loans, credit cards and publications.

At CPA Australia people are at the heart of what we do. We promote and encourage an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone can be their best.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Internet
  • Marketing and Advertising

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Marketing
  • Research
]
